summary:
Insomnia is a sleep disorder making it hard for people to fall or stay asleep. It can cause daytime tiredness, low energy, and mood changes. Insomnia might be short-term (days or weeks) or long-term (over a month). It can be caused by stress, pain, medical conditions, or habits like caffeine intake. Diagnosis involves discussing sleep patterns and checking for underlying causes.

Treatment starts with improving sleep habits, like having a regular bedtime and a calm sleep environment. Cognitive behavioral therapy can help change thoughts and actions related to sleep. While sleeping pills may be used, they have risks and are best for short-term use. Insomnia is common, affecting more adults over 65 and women.
title: Insomnia
